abstract.t: Open Caching architecture is a use case of Content Delivery Networks Interconnection (CDNI) in which the commercial Content Delivery Network (CDN) is the upstream CDN (uCDN) and the ISP caching layer serves as the downstream CDN (dCDN). This document proposed extensions to the RFC8006 Metadata Model by way of a set of GenericMetadata objects that address extend the original CDNI capabilities to meet the more general needs of the CDN and Open Caching industry. Extensions to RFC8008 are also introduced to allow a dCDN to advertise support for these extended metadata capabilities.
